arm_group.description: Physiotherapy: including vestibular rehabilitation and multimodal treatment for the cervical spine, once weekly with the study physiotherapist for 8 weeks or until time of medical clearance to return to sport.  This group also received the control intervention.

Control: postural education, general range of motion and strengthening in addition to the standard of care rest followed by graded exertion.  Individuals were seen once weekly for eight weeks or until time of medical clearance to return to sport.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine the effects of a combined physiotherapy treatment
      (including vestibular rehabilitation and treatment for the cervical spine) in youth and
      young adults with ongoing symptoms of dizziness, neck pain and headaches following a
      sport-related concussion.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Physiotherapy in Individuals With Persistent Symptoms Following Concussion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Diagnosis of Sport-related concussion as per the Third International Consensus
             Guidelines

          -  Persistent symptoms (greater than 10 days) of dizziness, unsteadiness, neck pain
             and/or headaches reported on the Sport Concussion Assessment Tool 2 (SCAT2)

          -  Clinical examination findings suggesting vestibular and/or cervical spine involvement

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Fracture, other neurological conditions, musculoskeletal injuries (other than the
             cervical spine) that restrict activity and medications that affect neural adaptation

intervention.description: Control: postural education, general range of motion and strengthening in addition to the standard of care rest followed by graded exertion.  Individuals were seen once weekly for eight weeks or until time of medical clearance to return to sport.
intervention.intervention_name: Control postural education, general range of motion and strengthening in addition to the standard of care

intervention.description: Physiotherapy: including vestibular rehabilitation and multimodal treatment for the cervical spine, once weekly with the study physiotherapist for 8 weeks or until time of medical clearance to return to sport.

clinical_study.official_title: Physiotherapy Treatment (Including Vestibular Rehabilitation) Compared to Rest in Individuals With Persistent Symptoms of Dizziness, Neck Pain and/or Headache Following Sport-related Concussion.

overall_official.affiliation: Sport Injury Prevention Research Centre, University of Calgary
Sport Injury Prevention Research Centre, University of Calgary
Sport Injury Prevention Research Centre, University of Calgary

primary_outcome.description: Number of days to medical clearance by study physician
primary_outcome.measure: Days to medical clearance to return to sport

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported cervical spine pain rated on a scale of 0-10
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Numeric Pain Rating Scale Score-Neck Pain
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change between Baseline and 8 weeks or time of medical clearance

secondary_outcome.description: Self reported dizziness on a scale of 0-10
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Numeric Dizziness rating Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change between Baseline and 8 weeks or time of medical clearance

secondary_outcome.description: Self-report score for headache on a scale of 0-10
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Numeric Pain Rating Scale Score-Headache
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change between Baseline and 8 weeks or at time of medical clearance

secondary_outcome.description: Self report measure of confidence during 16 balance activities
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Activities Specific Balance Confidence Scale Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change between Baseline and 8 weeks or time of medical clearance

secondary_outcome.description: Self report measure evaluating perceived handicap secondary to dizziness
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Dizziness Handicap Index Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change between Baseline and 8 weeks or time of medical clearance

secondary_outcome.description: Multifaceted tool used in the assessment of concussion and includes domains of symptom report, cognitive function, balance and coordination
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Sport Concussion Assessment Tool 2 (SCAT2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change between Baseline and 8 weeks or time of medical clearance

secondary_outcome.description: Assessed clinically using an eye chart and a metronome set at 2 Hz.  Static visual acuity is measured 13 feet from the target.  The subjects head is rotated at 2 Hz and visual acuity is measured dynamically.  The difference between static and dynamic visual acuity is calculated.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change between Baseline and 8 weeks or time of medical clearance

secondary_outcome.description: Clinical test performed in sitting with head flexed and high velocity low amplitude motion into 5-15 degrees rotation is performed while the subject is asked to maintain focus with the examiner's nose.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at 8 weeks or time of medical clearance

secondary_outcome.description: Patient report of intensity and duration of dizziness with eight head or body motions
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in modified Motion Sensitivity Test Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change between Baseline and 8 weeks or time of medical clearance

secondary_outcome.description: Dynamic Balance Measure that includes 10 different movements and the ability to complete each activity is rated by the examiner.
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Functional Gait Assessment Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change between Baseline and 8 weeks or time of medical clearance

secondary_outcome.description: Test to evaluate the time (seconds) that an individual can maintain the head in a position of craniovertebral flexion and two finger widths above a pillow in crook lying.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change between Baseline and 8 weeks or time of medical clearance

secondary_outcome.description: Clinical test using a laser pointer affixed to a head piece on top of the head that is projected onto a bull's eye target.  Subject rotates head to left, right (rotation) or up (extension) to the maximum comfortable range and relocates to the perceived point of neutral head position with eyes closed.  A measures from the centre of the bull's eye is recorded.  A mean of three trials is recorded for each direction.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change between Baseline and 8 weeks or time of medical clearance

collaborator.agency: Alberta Centre for Child, Family & Community Research

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
